comments.text: This mother does not seem like she wants a relationship on equal terms. She wants to dominate her son 😢
comments.author: @EmmasLightOverTheBridge

comments.text: I like how she can't possibly fathom that maybe what she did and said in the conversation caused it
comments.author: @toenail4437

comments.text:
Thank you for your content, Marnie. I’m estranged myself, and I’m interested in the so-called “other side” since estranged parents always push this “two sides” story. I’ve yet to hear or see any real inclination toward the relationship.
It’s “confusing” in a way, because they claim to have such an intense desire for it to the point of showing all their suffering to the world. Yet when it’s actually possible to reestablish the connection, control, their own conditions, and power matter more to them in reality.

The self-centeredness, the lack of self-awareness, and crying on camera. This is a grown person. I don’t know, what do they expect?   Yes, mom I’ll be there for you all your life the way you want me to be because you worried too much.
They can’t see anything past themselves. It’s tiring. And she calls it “fuckery.” Ok
comments.author: @Кристинас-ы6з

comments.text: If you're the scapegoat, you need to leave the family of origin. I was the scapegoat. I'm so glad I left. My mental health is much better now
comments.author: @áinesolstice

comments.text: OH that's an interesting realization about why she didn't follow up Marnie- that she realized you probably wouldn't be harmed. Makes me wonder about the discard I experienced from a couple of relatives.
comments.author: @lr9559

comments.text: Interesting that they had a mutual agreement that she unanimously decided. I notice how her entire account of the situation is all about her being supremely important, the principal force dominating someone else's life, the angry goddess of childbirth and war who must be appeased.
comments.author: @darrynreid4500

comments.text: I am not so sure that all estranged mothers are human beings.

comments.text: Oh LORD, I really need this one. Ugh…

comments.text: It sounded to me like she thinks it's insulting because he wants to call her with his girlfriend. This makes me think that she wants to try and drive a wedge between them by talking to him alone first. Either to accuse the GF of trying to take him away from his family or otherwise demean her in some way. Maybe the gf is the one who helped him realize there was an unhealthy family dynamic. That's my tinfoil hat theory.

comments.text: I've really been racking my brain on this lately. I think phrases like "we can leave it in the past" or "we don't have to talk about the past" is still acknowledgement the past exists. It's not assuring, its actually a threat. Because they   want to continue weaponizing then forgetting the past when its convenient for them. We have to remember their mind's don't think like ours. They don't want to move on, they want to hold on forever. Healing is not allowed. The dysfunction continues. So we go no contact. And they act betrayed. Oh well.
comments.author: @arc8584

comments.text: Have these women forgotten that children leaving home is normal when they're adults? Are they just unable to cope with Empty Nest Syndrome? A few months? Maybe they're busy! Maybe adulting is hard, and you're clearly not helpful in it! When your child is grown, you should be happy to hear from them whenever! Cut the chord, Lady!
comments.author: @Thundersnowdog

comments.text: Trying to imagine... under what circumstances would I ever look at a camera while looking this pitiful. There is nothing. This woman has no self-awareness at all. Incredibly embarrassing.

comments.text: Holy moly, that fake laugh was really uncanny. But I also noticed how much she strokes her hair and touches her face when she’s telling her version of events. It’s telling!

comments.text: Looks like onion tears ...there is some water coming out, but her face doesn't match. My mother was big on emotional violence, but more a silent raging type, demanding respect and care, but she  never even tried to squeeze a tear.

comments.text:
In my case also a phone call was requested. The EP “apologized” and said “I’m sorry you feel
That way.” Im sure the EP thinks that was a “good” conversation. Once there was space from the conversation the circular conversations, confusion, and total lack of accountability became clear. It took a few days to get out of the FOG before the decision to go no contact could be made.
comments.author: @AndWhatWhy
